trans-unit.source: Portal Administrators
trans-unit.target: Portal Administrators

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Portal Administrators
trans-unit.target: Portal Administrators

trans-unit.source: In <token>firstref_acs</token>, <newTerm>portal administrators</newTerm> are users who have access rights to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal for a specific <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: In <token>firstref_acs</token>, <newTerm>portal administrators</newTerm> are users who have access rights to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal for a specific <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: When you create an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in the Azure Management Portal (for more information, see <link xlink:href="dba0b42b-c631-4f60-bb3a-7b84d2ac406f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create an Access Control Namespace</link>), <token>secondref_act</token> automatically creates default portal administrator accounts for the subscription’s service administrator and co-administrators and adds <token>ms_acct</token> as a default identity provider.
trans-unit.target: When you create an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in the Azure Management Portal (for more information, see <link xlink:href="dba0b42b-c631-4f60-bb3a-7b84d2ac406f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create an Access Control Namespace</link>), <token>secondref_act</token> automatically creates default portal administrator accounts for the subscription’s service administrator and co-administrators and adds <token>ms_acct</token> as a default identity provider.

trans-unit.source: The portal administrators can delegate administrative access for particular <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s to other users.
trans-unit.target: The portal administrators can delegate administrative access for particular <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s to other users.

trans-unit.source: To create a portal administrator for a namespace, use the <ui>Portal Administrators</ui> section of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: To create a portal administrator for a namespace, use the <ui>Portal Administrators</ui> section of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Within the designated namespace, these new portal administrators have the same level of access rights as the original (default) portal administrator.
trans-unit.target: Within the designated namespace, these new portal administrators have the same level of access rights as the original (default) portal administrator.

trans-unit.source: Portal administrators for a <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> can log into the management portal for that particular <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> by using a federated user account, such as a <token>ms_acct</token> account.
trans-unit.target: Portal administrators for a <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> can log into the management portal for that particular <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> by using a federated user account, such as a <token>ms_acct</token> account.

trans-unit.source: Portal administrators have permission to add, delete, and change all configuration settings for the namespace, including other portal administrator accounts and management service credentials.
trans-unit.target: Portal administrators have permission to add, delete, and change all configuration settings for the namespace, including other portal administrator accounts and management service credentials.

trans-unit.source: Portal administrators for <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> can access only their designated namespace.
trans-unit.target: Portal administrators for <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> can access only their designated namespace.

trans-unit.source: They do not have permission to create or manage other <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s.
trans-unit.target: They do not have permission to create or manage other <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s.

trans-unit.source: Adding Additional Portal Administrators
trans-unit.target: Adding Additional Portal Administrators

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal uses <newTerm>federated identities</newTerm>, that is, administrative accounts are hosted by identity providers, not by <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal uses <newTerm>federated identities</newTerm>, that is, administrative accounts are hosted by identity providers, not by <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s.

trans-unit.source: To promote a user to be an <token>secondref_acs</token> portal administrator, the identity provider that hosts the user account must be added and configured in the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: To promote a user to be an <token>secondref_acs</token> portal administrator, the identity provider that hosts the user account must be added and configured in the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: If a user account of a new portal administrator is hosted by an identity provider other than <token>ms_acct</token>, you need to add the identity provider to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: If a user account of a new portal administrator is hosted by an identity provider other than <token>ms_acct</token>, you need to add the identity provider to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d95e2c9c-5ca8-4d42-be6b-9e5c778d5671" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Add Portal Administrators</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d95e2c9c-5ca8-4d42-be6b-9e5c778d5671" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Add Portal Administrators</link>.

trans-unit.source: When you add a portal administrator, you are redirected to the <ui>Portal Administrators</ui> page.
trans-unit.target: When you add a portal administrator, you are redirected to the <ui>Portal Administrators</ui> page.

trans-unit.source: The page display includes a URL to access the management portal for this namespace.
trans-unit.target: The page display includes a URL to access the management portal for this namespace.

trans-unit.source: You can provide this URL to the new portal administrators and they can use it to open the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal for this namespace.
trans-unit.target: You can provide this URL to the new portal administrators and they can use it to open the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal for this namespace.

trans-unit.source: This URL cannot be used to access the Azure Management Portal or to manage other <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s.
trans-unit.target: This URL cannot be used to access the Azure Management Portal or to manage other <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s.

trans-unit.source: Deleting Portal Administrators
trans-unit.target: Deleting Portal Administrators

trans-unit.source: When you delete the portal administrator for a <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, you revoke the administrator's access to the namespace.
trans-unit.target: When you delete the portal administrator for a <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, you revoke the administrator's access to the namespace.

trans-unit.source: To delete a portal administrator:
trans-unit.target: To delete a portal administrator:

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Portal administrators</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Portal administrators</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Check the box beside a portal administrator account and then click <ui>Delete</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Check the box beside a portal administrator account and then click <ui>Delete</ui>.

trans-unit.source: When you delete a portal administrator, the management service key, which can be used to manage the portal, is not changed.
trans-unit.target: When you delete a portal administrator, the management service key, which can be used to manage the portal, is not changed.

trans-unit.source: ACS does not programmatically update the management service key when a portal administrator is removed, because doing so might interrupt access to solutions in production that use the management service keys.
trans-unit.target: ACS does not programmatically update the management service key when a portal administrator is removed, because doing so might interrupt access to solutions in production that use the management service keys.

trans-unit.source: When you delete a portal administrator account, consider updating the management service key for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: When you delete a portal administrator account, consider updating the management service key for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: To generate a new management service key:
trans-unit.target: To generate a new management service key:

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select a management service account, such as <ui>ManagementClient</ui>, and then click <ui>Symmetric Key</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select a management service account, such as <ui>ManagementClient</ui>, and then click <ui>Symmetric Key</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Delete the value in the <ui>Key</ui> field, click <ui>Generate</ui>, and then click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Delete the value in the <ui>Key</ui> field, click <ui>Generate</ui>, and then click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To add, delete, and change management keys programmatically, use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: To add, delete, and change management keys programmatically, use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Code Sample: Management Service</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/gg185970.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> sample includes methods for adding, deleting, and updating management service keys.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Code Sample: Management Service</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/gg185970.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> sample includes methods for adding, deleting, and updating management service keys.

trans-unit.source: Code Sample: Management Service
trans-unit.target: Code Sample: Management Service
